alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 10 at 4:26AM AKST until February 10 at 7:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Snow accumulations of up to one inch. Wind gusts to 40 mph possible. Reduced visibilities to one quarter mile. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...Until 7 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. The cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow and gusty northeasterly winds will persist into this evening, bringing blizzard conditions to the Kuskokwim Delta. The worst conditions are expected along the coast, but could push as far inland as Bethel.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
